summary: The project manager opens the meeting by going over the minutes of the last meeting, detailing the main points of each person's presentation. They do the prototype presentation which includes a model of the remote control. The group discusses this proposed model, approving of the small size and look of it. They goes over finances and are pleased to find that they are well within budget. However, while the marketing expert is doing the product evaulation the group realizes that they neglected to calculate voice recognition into the financing. Their cost had been 8.20 Euros and they have  4.30 left to cover it, so they decide to settle for whatever quality it will buy. They rate their product on its shape, size, color, feel, and functionality. They discuss the project process, talk briefly about adding more features, and one member suggests eliminating a mute buttons and include a diffferent feature. They are happy with the creativity, leadership, and teamwork within the group, and close the meeting by thanking one another.
decisions: The remote is a snail shape with bright colors, blue and yellow with multi-colored buttons. Compact in size. It includes a remote holder in the shape of a shell. The case will be made of plastic and the buttons of soft rubber. Its features will include an on/off button, two mute buttons, nine channel buttons, two buttons for increasing/decreasing the volume, two buttons for scrolling up/down channels, a menu button in the center which controls the color/sharpness/brightness of the picture, and a swapping button. Channel buttons numbered, rest of the buttons have symbols indicating function. Light emitting diode is flourescent green. In their cost evaluation they got 8.20, not factoring in the voice recognition feature. They decide to settle for the level of quality the remaining 4.30 euros will get them.
problems: The group spent 8.20 euros on their product, but they almost forgot to factor in voice recognition, which may cost more than the 4.30 euros remaining. They will have to settle for whatever level of quality that 4.30 euros can buy.

1: Specification of Components

Case 
      a.Plastic
      b. Strong
      c. no harmful materials
      d. recyclable
	  e. Use of coloring compounds

Integrated Circuit (labeled "TA11835”)
      a. Highly sophisticated
      b. resistant to hign as well as low temperatures
      c. with timer and alarm facility
      Resistor
Capacitor
2: Specification of Components

Diode
Transistor
Resonator
Battery
     a. Rechargeable
 Circuit board
3:
You press a button
When you do that you complete a specific connection. 
The chip senses that connection and knows what button you pressed. 
It produces a morse-code-line signal specific to that button. 
The transistors amplify the signal and send them to the LED, which translates the signal into infrared light.
 The sensor in the TV can see the infrared light and "seeing" the signal reacts appropriately
9:
a push button requires a simple chip, but a scroll wheel requires minimally a regular chip, which is in a higher price range. 

As energy source we offer a basic battery or, more ingenious, a hand dynamo (such as in 50 years old torches), a kinetic provision of energy (such as some modern watches that you shake casually to provide energy), or use of solar cells.

Our products can be delivered in different cases. The general case is uncurved (flat). A more original case is single curved or even double curved.
10:
case material supplements, such as plastic, rubber (such as used in anti-RSI stress balls), wood, and titanium (which we also use in our production of space designs). Unfortunately, we can't use the titanium for the double curved cases and latex cases won't allow the use of solar cells as energy source. 
For the electronics, we can use a simple, a regular or an advanced chip on print. The chip on print includes an infrared sender. Furthermore we just developed a sample sensor/ sample speaker.

0:
Presented by: Jahnavi, Industrial Designer
And 
Francina User Interface designer.
1: Look and feel

We have made a model which looks like a snail and made up of clay.
Case
     a. form: snail
     b. Material: Plastic
     c. Color: Blue.
Interface Elements:
      a. Function: 
           i. Switch On/Off button placed on the top, material used is soft rubber, form is round, color is red.
           ii. LED: front, florouscent green, bulb, oval.
           iii. Mute: white, side, round, soft rubber.
           iv. Channel Buttons: round, yellow, soft rubber, both sides.
           v. Next/Previous channel buttons & Voice control buttons: Orange, round, Soft rubber.
           vi. Menu button: Green, round, soft rubber.
Case holder could be in shell shape.
Method

An energy source(say battery) feeds an integrated circuit (chip) that can compose messages, often in the form of infrared bits. 
A user interface controls the chip, and accordingly the messages.
2: Extra features

The text/ buttons which can be seen even if it is dark (like flouroscent)
A beep if many buttons are pressed at a time.
Child lock
Make it usable for more than one device.
Different shapes.
Display clock.
3:
Buttons
Bulbs
Infra-red bulbs
Battery(power suppy)
Chip
Wires

1: Method

The function of a remote is to send messages to the television : 
The messages are :
1.Switch on/off
2.Switch to next channel
3.Swaping the channels
4.Switching on to a particular channel
2:
turning the volume up/dowm
Switch for getting subtitles
Switch to control features like colour,contrast,sharpness,brightness
Memory switch
Mute button
Speech recognition feature :integrated, programmable, sample sensor/sample speaker unit such as voice recogniser
5: Stores Up to 80 speech samples, Controls 4 Devices -TV, Cable/Satellite, VCR/DVD & Audio. Record your own verbal labels that is connected to a remote control function : voice recognition
7: This jumbo universal remote control is almost impossible to misplace or lose.
8: Speech recognicer which will respond to voice.

1: Method

1.functional design :purpose is to control the television function using a remote.

There should be switch on/off button .
There should be signal or a LED which can be used to change different functionalities in the television.
There should be some timer to set for viewing a particulat programme or switching on/off according to the user 
There should be a child lock system .

It should be compact.
It should be in the shape of a “T” alphabet for more compactibility
Using of plactic for making the remote
2: Findings

There are different remote which can be used

Infre red remote

Radio wave remote

Remotely controlling a range of television functionality
3:
Multipurpose use
Child lock
To save electricity
Timer

1: Method

Will it sell????
Show prototype to people from various age and socio-economic groups
Show prototype to consumer research groups
Go with our best intuition
2: Findings

Shape biomorphic
Size small
Color bright warm
Feel as soft as possible
Functionality  (people won’t use it before they buy it – paradoxically other “features” will be main selling points
3:
Criteria rating with seven-point scale
Shape biomorphic 1
Size small  4
Color bright warm 1
Feel as soft as possible 3
Functionality  (people won’t use it before they buy it – paradoxically other “features” will be main selling points) 5

1: Method

Gather suggestions
Accept/eliminate suggestions according to design and budget feasibility
Consult industrial engineer on cost and lead time for each feature (we need to go to market by Sept for the Christmas market)
Consult user interface person on “friendliness” of features and hierarchy of importance for inclusion
2: Findings

Whole house control will not be possible
Some extended electronic entertainment control should be possible, i.e. DVD, CD, stereo tuner, vcr
It takes too much time to learn how to use a new remote control (34%) 
Remote controls are often lost somewhere in the room (50%)
3:
Concentrate on « sizzle »
Shorten learning curve
Simplicity is good - minimalism
Finding it is important
Should be attractive impulse purchase at 25 euros
We put the fashion in electronics!

1: Method

Reading press and ads
Internet
Personal observation in groups frequented
2: Findings

Small is beautiful
Simple is beautiful
Eye catching is important
3:
Get to market before the competition
Develop one or two features we can dwell on in our ad campaign—too many will confuse the consumer and defeat us
Fruit and vegetable design – soft feel

doc.content:
[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

The introductions were brief and everyone stated their function. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	 It was decided to design a new remote control which would have multi-functions, i.e. turn on not only the TV, but other household gadgets. The design should also be compact and modern. A further point was raised as to finding mislaid controls, i.e. light sensor which would activate a signal.

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	 No problems arose.

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

Each member will follow their instructions.

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

Notechnical function design and the working design. In summary I can say that we all agree that the new remote control should be easy to use with user friendly features like special buttons, children locks and the product should be stylish.

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

It was decided that the target group is everybody who owns a TV. As directed by management the function will be limited to TV use and the company identity will be clearly retained on the product. Budget permitting cosmetic differences are desirable for different groups of people, e.g. elderly people who have trouble pushing a very tiny button. Fashionable covers for the remote control are desirable, like different shapes and colours.

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.
No major problems in the meeting.


	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

Each participant will develop the details discussed.

Dear Colleague,

 

 

 

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

The User Interface designer made her presentation. The remote should have 9 buttons for channel selection, as well as a volume button, button to activate subtitles etc. The design should be child friendly, e.g. few buttons, colourful, star-shaped buttons etc. She showed various possible remotes as to shape and colour including an oversized model. Her personal preference is speech recognition.

The industrial designer suggested a special case made out of plastic that is strong and without using harmful materials. She feels it should be recyclable. She would like to use colours for this remote.

An Integrated circuit board that is highly sophisticated and temperature resistant are among her suggestions. In addition, the remote should include a timer and alarm, resistor and capacitor (battery).

 

The marketing expert mentioned her methods of information gathering, e.g. checking out the competition, doing research on the internet and through personal observations. Her findings showed that the item should be small, easy to use and eye catching. One of the most important factors from the ME’ point of view is to get to market before the competition. Develop one or two special features on which we can base our marketing campaign – too many special features creates confusion.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



The remote should be battery operated with a chip. Trendy design, compact and strong. Buttons should be used. Special feature – speech recognition. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



No problems arose.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

 

Each participant will develop their task, The UID and the ID will work together to come up with a prototype of this new remote.

ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

design a remote control

	a* with min.production cost about 12.50 euros7item.

	Should be compact

	Should have some mechanism by which one can find if it is lost are misplaced.

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	 

	 

	 the compactness.

	make the remote controller functionable for different things like TV, air conditioning, music player etc.

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

Work on technical functional design and specify user interface 

And working design

ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 In the meeting several marketing design and user interface issues were discussed. The marketing manager has talked about the attracting people, releasing the product by Christmas, and cost. The Industrial Designer talked about the working model, components required and features can be added. The user Interface person talked about the features which peoplr may want also some good points like child lock facility.

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

The remote controller will be usable only for TV. A single model will be released to meet the requirements of people of all kinds and age groups.

	  

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

How big the buttons should be.

	How to control the cost.

	How to make attractive to everybody.

	What new features can be included. 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.



Have lunch and chat for sometime.

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 In the meeting the User Interface designer showed many possible models and their advantages and disadvantages. She has also proposed speech recognition feature in the remote controller which is interesting. The industrial designer talked about the technical stuff and components used in the remote controller as well as how it works.

The marketing person has discussed various surveys she has done and told that compat and simple is beautiful.

  

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

User Friendly 

	colourful

	compact

	use battery for power supply

	

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

Speech recognition facility in the remote controller.

	How to make it more attractive.

	Cost effective

	

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

Make the model of remote controller with the clay provided.

Fill up the questionnaires.

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 The prototype is presented. The remote controller is blue in color with buttons yellow, green, and orange colors. The shape in like a snail. Very compact. Marketing wise its sellable, and possesses nice functionalities. The cost is less and room for more features. Finally, its been decided that the project is successfully done with team work, and research.

The product will be further evaluated for the inclusion of speech recognition feature and the final cost will be evaluated.

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.


	*The shape of the product.

	*The color of the product.

	*marketing strategy.

	*Cost 


	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

Functionality.

	*Marketing

	 *Speech recognition.

	 

	  

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.



Take rest

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 

 Project manager  described the purpose of the meeting.she gave a sbrief introduction about the project and what what responsibilities each and every participant has on the project. This was followed by ideas from  each participant on the  design cost effective and useful ness , which concluded with a brief discussion.the interface design was discussed. 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

	

	1.we all agreed that the remote we design should  have multi purpose role.

	

	2.it should have a detector with which user can locate the remote easily when it is misplaced.

	

	3.it should be compact with attractive shape and size



	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 

 Project manager  described the purpose of the meeting.she gave a sbrief introduction about the project and what what responsibilities each and every participant has on the project. This was followed by ideas from  each participant on the  design cost effective and useful ness , which concluded with a brief discussion.the interface design was discussed. 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

	

	1.we all agreed that the remote we design should  have multi purpose role.

	

	2.it should have a detector with which user can locate the remote easily when it is misplaced.

	

	3.it should be compact with attractive shape and size



	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.



Project leader went through the agenda.which was followed  by different ideas by  the marketing manager who highlighted the business strategy as how to make the product which will be appealing and saleble in the market.The industrial designer presented with the important feature a r emote control should have which will be cost effective.Finally the user interface designer highlightled certain features which should be kept in mind while designing a remote which a user would like to have .

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	 

	 1.to design a  user friendly model which will be suitable for all category of people,which should have special features for kids, elderly people  and those who have nerve problems.

	

	2.To make use of fluorescence light in the remote

	

	3.to design a cost effective model

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

	

	We have to design a user friendly ineterface with is cost effective

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 



The user interface designer  introduced  by showing different kinds of interface available in the market.then he went on  explaining about the different features a remote can have to enhance its features.

One of the interesting feature to incorporate would be to include voice recognition feature.evryone agreed upon adding this feature in the remote.the industrial designer suggested what kind of materials and batteries ,chips can be used which will be cost effective.Market expert gave emphesis on features like  compactness,shape and attractivess of the remote

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	use speech recognition

	to make a attractive case

	cost effective

	compact

	soft remote made up of clay 

	

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	

	 

	 how to make a cost effective and attractive remote

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.



user interface and industrial designers will make a prototype

marketing expert will come up with a marketing strategy.

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 The project manager went over the budget for the prototype. It was thought to be a little underestimated. Then, the prototype was unveiled and all the features were explained. The marketing manager then pointed out some other financial issues and considerations, mainly that the actual cost per unit would be higher than projected by the project manager. We then discussed the possibility of web-marketing and seasonal testing and releases, to correspond to potential peaks in the market.
